abstract: The decision by the public-radio show “This American Life” to retract an episode on the factories in China that make Apple devices exposed the differences between theater and journalism.
snippet: The decision by the public-radio show “This American Life” to retract an episode on the factories in China that make Apple devices exposed the differences between theater and journalism.
lead_paragraph: David Carr, the Media Equation columnist, wrote on Monday  about the decision by the public radio show “This American Life” to retract an episode on the factories in China that make Apple devices. The episode was based on a one-man show by Mike Daisey, “The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs.” Mr. Carr and Brian Stelter discussed the differences between theater and journalism.

headline.main: Carr and Stelter on a Retraction by ‘This American Life’
